article_title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch Issued; Wichita area included
article_text:
We are in for another stormy day in Kansas.

The National Weather Service has issued a severe thunderstorm watch until 10:00 p.m. for much of central Kansas, including Wichita and Sedgwick County. Counties in the watch area are;

Brown, Butler, Chase, Chautauqua, Clay, Cloud, Cowley, Dickinson, Elk, Ellsworth, Geary, Greenwood, Harper, Harvey, Jackson, Kingman, Lincoln, Lyon, Marion, Marshall, McPherson, Morris, Nemeha, Osage, Ottawa, Pottawatomie, Reno, Republic, Rice, Riley, Saline, Sedgwick, Shawnee, Sumner, Wabaunsee and Washington.

Any storm that develops could produce strong and severe weather. While the most likely region for severe weather is across North Central Kansas. Despite the greatest threat for severe weather occurring north of Wichita, severe weather is still possible in and around Sedgwick County.

Flooding is possible today also.

Be sure to download the KAKE News app and sign up for text alerts .

Stay tuned for forecast updates and weather alerts. You can track the storms with our Interactive Radar and LIVE weather coverage . And be sure to download the KAKE News app and sign up for text alerts .

article_metadata.description: Severe weather threat returns for Memorial Day. Large hail, high wind and isolated tornadoes possible with afternoon storms.
article_metadata.author: Meteorologist Frank Waugh --
